intro: Calceolaria albula, commonly known as the white slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blooms that are highly ornamental. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers partial shade. Calceolaria albula is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens and as a cut flower.
